sub_topic: Finding the Ramsey number of a graph.
message_1: What is the Ramsey number R(4,4)?
message_2:
The Ramsey number R(4,4) is the smallest integer N such that any graph with N vertices will contain either a clique of size 4 (a complete subgraph with 4 vertices, all connected) or an independent set of size 4 (a subgraph with 4 vertices, none connected). 

The Ramsey number R(4,4) is known to be 18.
